item.title: Business Chinese New Year Greetings
item.description: The Chinese New Year, which lands on January 31st in 2014, is a time to offer New Year greetings to your Chinese colleagues and business contacts. These greetings are customary upon the first meeting or conversation during the 15 days of the New Year celebrations. The most popular greetings are “Happy New Year” (新年快乐, xin nian kuai le) and “Congratulations on receiving riches and prosperity” (恭喜发财, gong xi fa cai).
